intro: Varronia holguinensis, commonly known as the Holguín varronia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Varronia holguinensis is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
